wikipedia_page.main: Frederick William Anderson FRSE FIB FSA (1905–1982) was a British geologist and palaeontologist. In the field of Ostracods he gives his name to the Anderson Cycles.

response: * Frederick William Anderson (1883–1955), civil engineer, rancher and political figure in British Columbia
* Frederick William Anderson (geologist) (1905–1982), British geologist and palaeontologist

Frederick William Anderson (September 28, 1883 – April 28, 1955) was a civil engineer, rancher and political figure in British Columbia. He represented Kamloops in the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia from 1916 to 1924 as a Liberal.
Lamont was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh on 6 March 1950, upon the proposal of Sir Edward B Bailey, Arthur Holmes, John G C Anderson and Frederick William Anderson.
